quest.name: Nothing Unsaid
journal: Y'shtola's eyes seem to be staring into your very soul.
objectives: Speak with Alisaie at the Inn at Journey's Head.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text:
At such moments, it is hard to know what to say...
...Are you all right, my friend?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You did well, Forename─you and the Exarch...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Shortly after you left, we observed that our enemy's ranks were no longer being replenished─presumably when your absence was noted. So we polished them off and came as quickly as we could.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...Which is to say, not quickly enough. But then you had the Exarch for company, didn't you, and you could ask for no better than that.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Ere we descended from the throne room, I did chance upon an object which, if I have the right of it, did once─

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: ...Hm. M-Mine apologies. Mayhap now is not an appropriate time. Let us speak of it later.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: The only way is forward. So I have to believe that whatever lies ahead will be better than what came before.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Forename. If you are ready, would you recount to us how the day unfolded?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...So you reached out to Elidibus at the last...and his heart was moved.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I'm not sure I did the right thing.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: And it changed nothing.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I only did as you asked.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Perhaps you did. Perhaps you did not. None can say.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Perhaps not. Ultimately, you had no choice but to strike him down.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I suppose you did.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: But the important thing is this: though violence proved unavoidable, you did at least come to understand your foe.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: And in knowing his hopes and dreams do we best remember him─him and his legacy.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: So long as they remain unforgotten, the love he and his brethren bore for one another and the star may yet be rewarded.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You said that an ancient came to your aid. But how is that possible?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: A gift from Emet-Selch. He knew of Elidibus's plight. Foreseeing his own death, he made provisions to bring Elidibus's suffering to an end, lest his friend be left to continue the struggle alone.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Or so I wildly speculate. It is unlikely we will ever know the truth.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The best we can do is to remember events as they happened, no more and no less. As the Ronkans so rightly put it, “History is learned, not lived.”

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: (-???-)Ah! There you all are!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: My friend! We were given to understand thou wert injured. Shouldst thou not be abed?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Lie down at a time like this!? Don't be absurd! I would have come sooner had the guards not made such a fuss!

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Now, tell me what's happened. Where is the Exarch?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: I see...

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Forename... Will you show me his spirit vessel?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Yes... Both his soul and memories seem intact. Good.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Unlike the others, his aether was not highly charged, and so it did not seem necessary to employ a familiar for the imbuing. But I needed to be certain all the same. Oh, what a relief...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Then 'tis but a question of restoring his soul unto his flesh.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: And as thou didst lately tell me, the success of this process resteth on no more than our friend's soul recognizing his flesh as its own.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Given his apparent desire to return to the Source with Forename, one would think his soul would be only too happy to be home, no? Surely it wouldn't balk at the relative newness of its accommodation?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: So one would hope, but none can speak for the Exarch's heart of hearts. And he can no longer speak for himself.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Furthermore, though I have drawn upon all of my not inconsiderable experience to predict the outcome, the fact remains that there is no direct precedent for what we are attempting.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Will his body accept his soul? Will his essences blend properly? Will he awaken whole of mind? Any number of things could go awry.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: ...Assuming I have succeeded in tempering your expectations, I should probably add that I did ask the Exarch if he still wished to return to the Source in full knowledge of the risks.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: A simple enough question, one would think, warranting a single-word reply. Yet the answer I received was rather longer than that. Almost comically so, in fact. Regardless, out of respect for the man, I shall attempt to recite it─with a certain amount of poetic license. Ahem!

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: “As I grew older, the burdens I carried became ever more numerous. Burdens which weighed upon my hopes, burying them deep within my breast. So deep that I couldn't be certain they were still there.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: “But when I look around me, I am reminded that, no matter how deeply buried they may be, our hopes never truly disappear. No, they are always with us. Guiding us. Driving us.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: “I see it in Vauthry, who sought to vindicate his existence by creating his paradise.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: “I see it in Ran'jit, who forsook his life's cause in order to protect that which he held most dear.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: “I see it in the people, who chose to struggle rather than surrender to despair.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: “And though our struggles may differ greatly, since the very beginning of time, they have all shared that one common thread: hope.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: “We struggle because we have hope. And when the time comes, I too will embrace mine. I will follow my heart, regardless of the risks.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: “And I will live with all my being, as befits one who has been granted a second chance.”

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: There! I told you it was long. And unspeakably sentimental to boot. One would think them the outpourings of a dewy-eyed boy, not the old man the Exarch seems to believe he is.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: I mean, really─he's scarcely been alive as long as I've been in hiding!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I daresay he is blushing in his vessel.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, we should make ready for our journey. Time remains of the essence, after all.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Needless to say, once we leave, there is no guarantee that we can return. If anyone has unfinished business, now is the time to see to it.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I must pay a visit to Slitherbough. Let us reconvene here anon.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Hm... There remain some few matters which require mine attention in Il Mheg.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: May I leave Thancred in thy care, child?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Um...I've been meaning to get some flowers. For Minfilia.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I thought you might help me choose them. And then we could go to Nabaath Areng together...one last time.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: A fine suggestion. Lead on.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well, it's back to Eulmore for me. Amongst other things, I owe the mayor an apology about his airship.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I assume you have places of your own to be, Alisaie. I shall see you later.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: I shall take this opportunity to conduct a final inspection of the spirit vessels. Given what is at stake, one can never be too thorough.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: As you've probably guessed, I'm going to pay a visit to the Inn at Journey's Head. But I want you to come too.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I realize you don't need to say any farewells.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But the Exarch does, if only in spirit. So I thought you might bring him along, so to speak.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'm sure he'd love the thought of being lugged about on his hero's back.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: So let's be off, shall we? I can't wait to see how Halric's doing!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Halric? Halric! Oh gods, don't tell me he's wandered off again?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Quickly, Forename! We have to find him!

dialogue.name: WILLFORT
dialogue.text: Oh, Alisaie! I didn't see you there. If you're looking for Halric, he's gone for a walk with one of the others. They were planning to visit the graveyard, if I'm not mistaken.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well, that's a relief. Shall we adjourn to the graveyard, then?

dialogue.name: JOURNEYSHEADNURSE
dialogue.text: Oh, greetings, Forename! Looking for Halric, by any chance?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: There he is. I was afraid he'd wandered off again.

dialogue.name: JOURNEYSHEADNURSE
dialogue.text: Oh, there's no need to worry─Halric's safe and well. He's been showing good progress, and likes to go for walks of late.

dialogue.name: JOURNEYSHEADNURSE
dialogue.text: Though his steps usually bring him to this particular spot...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Oh? I wasn't aware he had family here.

dialogue.name: JOURNEYSHEADNURSE
dialogue.text: He doesn't. It's Tesleen. Her sword, that is.

dialogue.name: JOURNEYSHEADNURSE
dialogue.text: We buried it here in her honor.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: So he remembers...

dialogue.name: JOURNEYSHEADNURSE
dialogue.text: What brings you back so soon, out of interest? I didn't think the next round of treatments was due yet.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Uh...no. It isn't. Look─I realize this is sudden...but I've come to say good-bye. It's time for me to return home.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But rest assured the treatments will continue. Beq Lugg will come to oversee them in my stead.

dialogue.name: JOURNEYSHEADNURSE
dialogue.text: I see... You did mention that you and your friends were searching for a way home.

dialogue.name: JOURNEYSHEADNURSE
dialogue.text: Needless to say, we'll be sorry to see you go─but I know everyone will be happy for you. Truly.

dialogue.name: JOURNEYSHEADNURSE
dialogue.text: Happy and grateful. You've done so much for us. Achieved what none of us dared hope was possible.

dialogue.name: JOURNEYSHEADNURSE
dialogue.text: And we'll see to it that your good work continues, and that no more poor souls are buried here before their time.

dialogue.name: JOURNEYSHEADNURSE
dialogue.text: So rest easy, and take care. We wish you every happiness.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Thank you. I will miss you all.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But it isn't time to say our farewells quite yet. So if there are any tasks that need doing─hunting beasts, fetching water, and what have you─just say the word.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I mean to make use of every last moment here. After all...

dialogue.name: HALRIC
dialogue.text: The time left to you...is precious...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: That's right, Halric... That's exactly right.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Those words will guide you true. So never forget them.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: And neither will I.

dialogue.name: HALRIC
dialogue.text: Take...care...

dialogue.name: JOURNEYSHEADNURSE
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming to see Halric, Forename. And Tesleen as well.

dialogue.name: JOURNEYSHEADNURSE
dialogue.text: She did always enjoy having visitors. And none were more welcome than you and Alisaie.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: What? I'm not crying! I just have sand in my eye, that's all.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...Ahem. As I mentioned, I mean to stay here as long as possible. In the meantime, perhaps you could go and look in on the others?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Alphinaud, for instance. If anyone is crying, it will be him!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: What are you still doing here? Hurry over to Eulmore and look in on Alphinaud. Oh, and send my regards to the Chais.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: I hear the airship crashed in Amh Araeng. Never mind. The important thing is you're all safe and well.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: That said, we should probably retrieve the wreck before the locals strip it for trolley parts. Or perhaps we can make a trade of it...

dialogue.name: DULIACHAI
dialogue.text: Oh, thank goodness you can still return! If I had to bid farewell to you both, my heart would burst here and now!

dialogue.name: DULIACHAI
dialogue.text: Like Alphinaud, I know that yours is a life of constant employment, but do visit us from time to time. It would mean the world to us.

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: I understand the Exarch will be leaving with you. Capable though its custodians are, the Crystarium will be poorer for his absence.

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: It seems the coming years will be a period of transition for both of our cities... But through mutual cooperation, I am confident we will find a way forward.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: 'Tis a strange feeling, Forename. To stand in the company of our friends, knowing that I will never see them again... I struggle to reconcile it in my mind.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But this I know: I shall cherish my memories of Norvrandt─of every soul I met here─for the rest of my days.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And I shall look forward to your tales of their endeavors.
